elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions on the factual text "Differentiation of sales contracts".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: How can purchase contracts be differentiated with regard to the object of purchase?
elements.correctAnswer: A distinction is made between the purchase of land and the purchase of movables. When purchasing movables, a further distinction is made as to whether the object of purchase is generic or specialty goods.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are generic goods?
elements.correctAnswer: Generic goods are products that are interchangeable (replaceable or justifiable).

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What are the characteristics of species goods?
elements.correctAnswer: These are individual items, i.e. goods that are only available once and therefore cannot be replaced.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What different types of sales contracts can be distinguished in terms of payment method?
elements.correctAnswer: Cash purchase, purchase against invoice (credit purchase), purchase of goods with credit agreement
